intro: Oxymeris regnellii, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Oxymeris regnellii is often found in moist, lowland areas and can grow up to 30 meters tall. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitat.
